section.title: Description
section.p: Transmission of pathogenic microorganisms or cancerous cells from an original site to one or more sites elsewhere in the body, usually by way of the blood vessels or lymphatics

stentry.p: Idenifiies the presence or absence of distant metastasis (M) as recorded by the physicain. Possible values are Not recorded by the physician; MX, M0; M1; M1a; M1b; M1c; not applicable etc.

Identifies the distant site(s) of metastatic involvement at time of diagnosis. Possible values are 00 No; Distant lymph node(s); Distant metastases except code 10 Distant metastasis, NOS Carcinomatosis; (40) + (10); Unknown; distant metastasis cannot be assessed,not stated in patient record; Not applicable etc.

Identifies only the site(s) of distant metastasis identified during initial diagnosis and workup. Possible values are None; Peritoneum; Lung; Pleura; Liver; Bone; Central nervous system; Skin; Lymph nodes (distant); Other/Gen/Carcinomatosis/Unkn; etc.

Identifies the second site of distant metastasis identified during initial diagnosis and workup. Possible values are None; Peritoneum; Lung; Pleura; Liver; Bone; Central nervous system; Skin; Lymph nodes (distant); Other/Gen/Carcinomatosis/Unkn; etc.

Identifies the third site of distant metastasis identified during initial diagnosis and workup. Possible values are None; Peritoneum; Lung; Pleura; Liver; Bone; Central nervous system; Skin; Lymph nodes (distant); Other/Gen/Carcinomatosis/Unkn; etc.
Indicates the code that identifies the presence or absence of distant metastases. Possible values are MX, M0, M1, M1A, M1B, M1C, Not Applicable; etc.
Identifies the presence or absence of distant metastasis (M) as recorded by the physician. Possible values are MX, M0; M1; M1a; M1b; M1c; Not applicable; etc.
